title.rendered: Work From Home? Here’s How The Right Home Services Can Improve Productivity

content.rendered:
Remote working is not exactly a new trend, as many people – especially those in the IT sector – have been working from home for a long time. However, ever since the pandemic broke out, the number of people who work from home has increased exponentially.

Creating an ideal work environment that can boost your productivity can be a challenge when you work from home. However, with the right home services, it can certainly be done. It makes sense to hire a dependable home services company because the work-from-home trend is here to stay.

Given below are three things you can do to improve your productivity while you work from home.

Get Your AC Checked

Did you know that indoor temperature can have an impact on your output and productivity? If it is too warm or too cold, you might not be able to concentrate on your work as you normally do. As a result, you might be prone to making mistakes that you would otherwise not make.

A study conducted by the Helsinki University of Technology in 2006 revealed that the ideal indoor temperature for optimizing workplace performance and productivity is 71.6º F. However, the exact temperature at which you are at your productive best might differ by a few degrees.

This is why it’s vital to inspect your air conditioner by a qualified AC professional. And, make sure it is working properly. This is the first step you need to take to make sure you can work from home comfortably.

Get Your Ventilation System Inspected

Spending long hours in enclosed spaces – whether it is your home or office – can increase the risk of recirculation – breathing in the same air that you breathe out. So, you need to make sure your ventilation system is working properly. The best way to do it is to get a HVAC professional to inspect it.

Particularly, you need to make sure your air duct is free of dirt and debris. A clogged air duct can push through allergens and pathogens into the air you breathe in, which can affect your health. It can be particularly problematic for those who are suffering from asthma, eosinophilia, auto-immune diseases, and pulmonary disorders. So, getting your air duct cleaned regularly is absolutely essential to maintain a safe and hygienic work environment at your home.

Get Your Insulation System Evaluated

Poor or inadequate insulation can affect indoor temperature and indoor air quality, which in turn can affect your productivity. Not to mention the fact that it can cause your energy bills to go through the roof! So, make sure you find a qualified technician to inspect it and upgrade it if needed.
